intro: Brickellia aramberrana, commonly known as the Mexican brickellbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Brickellia aramberrana is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh, drought-prone conditions.
